body: Could the maintainers kindly comment on this?

issue.title: Implement functionality to avoid fetching data twice in load function
issue.body:
### Describe the problem

The module=context "load function" fetches data twice, once on the server and once on the client. 

### Describe the proposed solution

Ideally, there should be an option to either cache data that was fetched server-side or to be able to configure the load function to not re-run on the client.

### Alternatives considered

https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3729
https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3731
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69075449/cant-fetch-data-from-api-in-sveltekit
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67921198/sveltekit-and-ssr
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64055809/svelte-module-script-being-run-multiple-times

Seems like there are many issues around this. The main solution is to use the onMount function, however, it feels a bit hacky, if data could be loaded server-side, and passed to the client (without having the client to reload it).

### Importance

i cannot use SvelteKit without it

### Additional Information

_No response_

body: I like this idea, we should do it

issue.title: Rename fetch
issue.body:
### Describe the problem

I've been using SvelteKit for a while now and only today I learned that depending on whether I pass `fetch` as a param in the load function, I get a "special fetch" or "normal fetch". And the "special fetch" is more optimized and doesn't load requests twice, as the "normal fetch" does.

I consider the current implementation something similar to monkey patching. It looks really good, almost magical.....a little too magical. Unless you read the documentation very thoroughly before you begin (or you learn the hard way as I did) it's easy to miss that the fetch is special.

I don't care what the special fetch is called, be it `specialFetch`, `svelteFetch`, `magicLoad` or whatever else - but calling it `fetch` is too confusing, imho.

### Describe the proposed solution

Rename `fetch` passed to the `load` function to something more distinct. 

### Alternatives considered

Alternatively - overwrite all fetch calls to be special fetch calls, at least that'll be consistent monkey patching.

### Importance

would make my life easier

### Additional Information

_No response_

body: To clarify, this issue seems to be saying that a fetch in the load function could/would be called in the browser if it's not the load special fetch? If so, I guess I've managed to write a fairly extensive svelte-kit app without realizing that code in the load function could have been (selectively) run in the browser. I always treated the load function  as running on the server.

@newlegendmedia see the [docs](https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/loading) - load runs on the client and the server.

> A component that defines a page or a layout can export a load function that runs before the component is created. This function runs both during server-side rendering and in the client, and allows you to fetch and manipulate data before the page is rendered, thus preventing loading spinners.

@geoffrich Thanks for the reference, I probably had no idea what that meant when I was first learning. Is there any general guide as to what parts of the load run on both sides? Is it all run on both places except the special fetch has some split logic in it? If thats difficult to answer, I can go explore that in other contexts. Thanks

Personally, I would prefer to rename the server-side fetch to something that helps the developer distinguish between what happens on front-end and back-end, but since #4193 is closed I guess I can live with whatever happens next. I don't mind - now I know. But it seems that I'm not the only one who was confused by this.

issue.title: warn if load uses `window.fetch`
issue.body:
closes #3731

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0
